newsitem.title: USA: USAir special meeting sought by Soros group.
newsitem.headline: USAir special meeting sought by Soros group.

text.p: A group led by financier George Soros said Tuesday it asked USAir Group Inc to hold a special meeting to elect two additional directors representing holders of series B preferred shares.
In a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, the group said it made the request in a October 16 letter, in which it asked that the meeting be held "at the earliest practicable date."

The group said holders of series B preferred shares had gained the right to elect two representatives to the board because the airline holding company had not paid dividends to the holders of those securities for the past six quarters.
The Soros group holds 4.99 percent, or 3,240,771 shares, of USAir common stock outstanding. It also holds 497,200 series B preferred shares, or 6.99 percent of the class outstanding.
